question: Question_12_(f)
statement:
Mark each statement either True or False. You do not have to justify
your answer.

The rank of any upper-triangular n Ã n matrix is the number of nonzero
entries on its diagonal.
sols:
\textbf{False}. The rank is the number of non zero rows in the matrix. A
counter example\[rref(A) = \begin{bmatrix}
1 & 0 & 0\\ 
0 & 0 &1 \\ 
0 & 0 & 0
\end{bmatrix}\] number of nonzeros in diagonal is 1 but the rank is 2.
